◆ process()

float bdsp::envelope::AR::process ( )

Definition at line 39 of file AR.cpp.

40 {
41 float output{0.0f};
42 float counter_inv{0.0f};
43
44 // Find next output
45 switch (state)
46 {
47 case State::IDLE:
48 output = 0.0f;
49 break;
50
51 case State::ATTACK:
52
53 // Find curve
54
55 // ATTACK "aims higher" to make the curve more linear, like in the analog circuit
56 // 12 V is given by the Eurorack power specs (envelope output peaks at 8 V)
57 // output = adsp::skewNormalized(counter, 1.8);
58 output = mappings::linear_norm(counter, seg_start, ENV_AMPLITUDE);
59
60 // Increment counter
61 counter += delta;
62 break;
63
64 case State::RELEASE:
65
66 // Shape and scale to desired linear segment
67 // Counter needs to be inverted for the correct shape of the decreasing segment
68 counter_inv = 1.0f - counter;
69 counter_inv = mappings::skew_norm_pos(counter_inv, 0.2f);
70 counter_inv = 1.0f - counter_inv;
71 output = mappings::linear_norm(counter_inv, seg_start, 0.0f);
72
73 // Decrement counter
74 counter += delta;
75
76 break;
77 }
78
79 // Check for state transitions
80 transition_state();
81
82 // Save output for future calculations
83 output_prev = output;
84
85 return output;
86 }

void transition_state()

Definition at line 88 of file AR.cpp.

89 {
90 // Adjust time to compensate the curve "aiming higher" in ATTACK
91
92 double time_adjusted = time;
93
94 if (state == State::ATTACK)
95 {
96 time_adjusted = 12.0f / 8.0f * time;
97 }
98
99 // Calculate new delta
100 delta = 1.0f / (time_adjusted * sample_rate);
101 }

void bdsp::envelope::AR::transition_state ( )
private

Definition at line 103 of file AR.cpp.

104 {
105 switch (state)
106 {
107 case State::IDLE:
108 // If triggered in IDLE..
109 if (is_triggered)
110 {
111 // Change to ATTACK
112 state = State::ATTACK;
113
114 // Get new timing constant
115 time = attack;
116
117 update_delta();
118
119 counter = 0.0f;
120
121 // Start ATTACK segment from zero
122 segment_start = 0.0f;
123 }
124 break;
125
126 case State::ATTACK:
127 // If ATTACK is over..
128 if (output_prev >= (PEAK_AMPLITUDE - VOLTAGE_MARGIN))
129 {
130 // Change to RELEASE
131 state = State::RELEASE;
132
133 // Get new timing constant
134 time = release;
135
136 update_delta();
137
138 counter = 0.0f;
139
140 // Start RELEASE from current output voltage
141 segment_start = output_prev;
142 }
143 break;
144
145 case State::RELEASE:
146 // If envelope is triggered in RELEASE..
147 if (is_triggered)
148 {
149 // Change to ATTACK
150 state = State::ATTACK;
151
152 // Set new timing constant
153 time = attack;
154
155 // Update increment
156 update_delta();
157
158 // Reset counter
159 counter = 0.0f;
160
161 // Start ATTACK from current output value
162 segment_start = output_preve;
163 }
164 // If RELEASE is over..
165 else if (output_prev <= (0.0f + VOLTAGE_MARGIN))
166 {
167 // Change back to IDLE
168 state = State::IDLE;
169 }
170 break;
171 }
172
173 // Untrigger envelope
174 is_triggered = false;
175 }
